MSB HEADQUARTERS
July 7, 1952
To the NAEB Board®
Gentlemen*
July 3rd was D-Day at Headquarters® At or about 6 p*m® a diversity of
Illinois truck, which was previously sent to Chicago, pulled up at the
back door of Greg Hall and delivered one beautiful Toogood- Smith mass
duplicator® Rawdon Smith accompanied the delivery and spent all day
the Uth with Bob Johnston perfecting the installation* Johnston is
running some checks of his own and promises that we will be doing an
increasingly greater amount of work on the duplicator so that t&a
end of July or perhaps a little sooner should see us completely free
of the old method of duplication®
All of the above means we will start direct servicing to all stations
at the completion of Package #7 and #8*
The coupletetion of the Allerton Seminar on which you now have a pre¬
liminary report and tba delivery of the duplicator plus the finalising
of the renewal of t he grant from Kellogg have kept us more than buay®
I still have nothing in writing on the Kellogg proposition but have
every assurance that it will go through and we will receive our second
year’s chock as soon as financial statements are prepared by the U of
I® This should be completed in a matter of days®
Meanwhile we have been working diligently on the FAE-480,000 grant and
we* 11 have a nice printed announcement of this within about two weeks®
We’ve also been working with Hull and Merrill on the Iowa State College
Television Workshop® We understand that JCET is now also a co-operator
which will mean considerable financial help on the meeting®
In as much* as I have been asked to line up the ij hour NAEB session, may
I suggest that we could do no better than to have a 30-40 minute speech
by our esteemed president and then have a question and answer session
of some 16 minutes with the officers of the Association serving as a
panel® If you have any ideas on this I’d be happy to hear frc&i you®
Jim Miles
Executive Director
